pros: Positive, caring work environment, thoughtful coworkers and management, everyone showing up to make a difference each day.
cons: Salary was a bit low for the area, but with nonprofits that's to be expected.

job_title: Volunteer and Event Coordinator in Toronto, ON
pros: Kind people to work with. Got to give back
cons: Weird work environment - not organized. Didn’t have authority to do job description

review_title: A charity of the Presbyterian Church, who ought to be ashamed - and ought to do something..
job_title: Breakfast Volunteer for Out of the Cold in Toronto, ON
pros: I volunteered there, and the work was worthwhile and gratifying.
cons: A new executive director took over, a new broom who swept clean. Swept out almost half the staff, especially the older ones, including the friend who recruited me to volunteer there. They retired earlier than they wanted to, or found another job, or were fired "for cause" - or left before the exec director could find a "cause" to fire them.

job_title: Youth Program Support Worker in Toronto, ON
pros: I enjoyed my job working with youth. There was freedom to create programs. I always had the support from my immediate supervisor and directors.
cons: They cancelled youth programs to focus on adults.

pros: It's a good cause, some good people to work with and it's a safe environment. You get inspired almost every day to do something better.
cons: Lot's of changes inside the organization, hard to keep up with. Loyal employees are not appreciated.

pros: Thoughtful and effective management, extremely friendly and well-meaning coworkers, no drama, good benefits
